page.title: 03Local History
page.content:
{BOLSOVER CASTLE
Bolsover Castle is a major tourist attraction. It stands on the crest of an escarpment which runs from north to south through the eastern part of the survey area. The site dates back to {Norman times}when{William the {Conqueror}gave the site to{William {Peveril.}A keep was built at that time and the present keep or 'Little Castle' stands on that site. The present keep was built by{Sir Charles {Cavendish}in 1613.{William,}his son, added the Riding School (now restored) and the Terrace (now ruined). The keep contains about 30 apartments. At the present time the old Smithy, next to the Riding School, is being restored. When restoration work is complete it will probably house a museum and tea-room.
